Class NetPair

java.lang.Object
NetPair
public class NetPair extends Object
Pair of NetSockets that represents a connection to another node

  • Constructor Summary

    Sole constructor

  • Constructor Details

    • NetPair

      public NetPair(NetSocket _listener, NetSocket _broadcaster)
      Sole constructor
      Parameters:
      _listener - listening NetSocket, can be undefined while waiting for another connection
      _broadcaster - broadcasting NetSocket, always should be defined

  • Method Details

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shuts down listener and broadcaster, but may wait to finish their current operation. If the socket is already disconnected, do nothing

    • forceShutdown

      public void forceShutdown()
      Shuts down listener and broadcaster regardless of their current state

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects a NetPair from the connected node. Sends a disconnect message to the other node. Removes itself from the parent array, removing references and allowing garbage collection to reclaim it If the NetPair is already disconnected, do not disconnect.

    • disconnectNoMessage

      public void disconnectNoMessage()
      Same as disconnect() but does not send a message to the other node. Used when a disconnect message is recieved and sending a message would be redundant

    • ready

      public void ready()
      Used when listener is ready to listen, and opens the node for listening to the other node

    • checkState

      public void checkState()
      Debugging function

    • listenForMessages

      public void listenForMessages()
      lol idk
